content.description: This is a very unique pitch that climbs up great plates and crack to a bridge that’s formed by the collapse of an old pinnacle that now leans on the wall behind it. Interesting climbing throughout and some cool, exposed moves on the bridge too.
content.location: Hike up the canyon behind Low Dome, checking for pictographs along the way. Keep on going up for over an hour. Check pics to Id formation

content.description: There are many worthy cracks to climb on this wall. You could spend a day here doing single pitch or linking features from the lower to upper tiers to make 2 pitch climbs. Formation is North facing and gets very little sun.A better description might put this area in the newly created Pictograph Canyon (GrayBeards) area as its in a canyon of its own behind low dome. Puppy and Gumbo towers which are nearby will be added to  that other area.
